args:
The prince hears of the Dragon Necropolis, a
place where he might be able to awaken the
power of the Five Greatwyrms and gain the
strength to resist Xenos. But having found this
ray of hope, he and his friends are suddenly
attacked by fiends and corrupted dragons.
In the north, in the midst of the evacuation...
I had hoped to put more distance between\nourselves and Grams today, but I think we\nshould stop here for the night.
I can still keep walking, but the people\nof Grams...
No, we can't push them any further today;\nit was hard enough just getting everyone\nout of the city.
And it's not just their physical stamina\nthat's exhausted. Emotionally, most of\nthem have nothing left.
Little wonder, considering we just sent\nSatan packing and they were trying to get\nthe city back on track.

The momentary hope they held was
shattered, and they were left with no
choice but to abandon homes and lives
and run for the hills.
I don't even know what to say...
A musical instrument? Who in the world\nis playing songs at a time like this?!\nRead the damn room, people!
Let's go put a stop to this, darling.
It's Emile and the Dyrenell Army Band...
Hey! Why are you idiots playing such\ncheery music when people are barely\nholding it together?!
That's on them if they're depressed!\nWhy must I accompany them down such\na dark and dreary road?
I'll pass on such depression, thank you.
Can we listen to you play, mister?
Oh ho! Children who appreciate this art?\nHow very promising! Yes, gather round!\nI grant you permission to hear our tunes!
Well, I suppose the children look happy...
Indeed. I couldn't even find the words\nto say to them, and yet my brother...
It appears my baby brother has come to\nunderstand something about governance.

It's something I've taught you before.
A monarch does not have the luxury to
suffer during a time where their people
are doing so.

...Yes, I remember.
Suffering citizens don't want a monarch
who suffers with themâ€”they want
someone to lift them out of their pain.

Well, you're terrible at putting it into
action. Instead, you retain a nasty habit
of trying to suffer right along with your
people.
But isn't Emile just being self-indulgent?
Is he? Heh. I wonder. Either way, though,\nthe end result leads to some small bit\nof joy for the people.
I think he's finally become aware of how\nbest to use his particular skill set.
I suppose he HAS always possessed\na penchant for music and the arts.\nIn fact, he's even taught me some of it.
Entertainment can often be an exceedingly\npowerful tool for a statesperson.
Drama, music, poetry. One would struggle\nto find more convenient tools to guide the\nhearts and minds of their citizens.
Depending on how you wield it, you can\nunite the people as one, or turn their eyes\naway from misrule. Whatever you desire.
And you believe that's a good use\nof Emile's talent?
I'm not sure. It's true that another option\nwould be simply to immerse himself in the\ncreation of art...
But he has lived a life without having his\ntalents recognized by those around him.

Though born a prince in possession of said
talent, he was never in an environment
where he could make any use of it.
How unhappy that must be.

With all the people talking about him
behind his back and the numerous
setbacks he has suffered, I'm sure he's
given up on much in his life.

You're probably too pure to realize this,
but there are some people who can't
survive this cruel world without giving up
on occasion or letting go of an ideal.
The world's not the kind of place where\nyou always get what you want so long as\nyou just ï¼‚go for itï¼‚ with a plucky attitude!
(Those words must have come from a\nplace of experience.)
I saw our brother as a sulky and corrupt\nhuman being. I was exasperated with him,\nand felt him to be truly hopeless.
I don't know what happened in the mean,\nbut he has changed.
We need to talk. Can I have a minute?
We make for the desert to the east,\nand you're coming with us.
I saw a memory in the Sacred Tree\nthat showed the Progenitor's return\nbeing prevented.
In it, the Five Greatwyrms were fighting\nthe Progenitor.
But not even Bahamut could stand\nagainst the Progenitor.
And the Five Greatwyrms could not either\nin their current stateâ€”which is why we\nhave to awaken their power.
When a high-order dragon such as one of\nthe Five Greatwyrms dies, it reincarnates\ninto a new body.
The forms they possess now are a result of\nseveral reincarnations, and over that time\nthey have lost both memories and strength.

In other words, the Five Greatwyrms we
know don't have the strength to defeat
the Progenitor, so we're gonna help 'em
get it back.
I assume all of this has something to do\nwith going to the desert?
Yeah, we think there's something there\nthat... Well, the desert is what used to be\nGatov's homeland, so I'll let him explain.
There was a place in my former homeland\nknown as the Dragon Necropolis.
It is where the primordial dragons that\nbecame the very foundation of the world\nrest eternallyâ€”or so it is said.
So does that mean it's where the original\nFive Greatwyrms are?
Still, this is all just a legendâ€”and even if\nwe DO find this boneyard, it doesn't mean\nwe'll be able to awaken the Five's powers.
But it's the only chance we have now.\nAnd since you've got pacts with the Five,\nyou need to come along.
That all makes sense, but what about\nthe people of Grams?
I proposed this evacuation planâ€”\nI can't just abandon it halfway through.
Do you think you're so important that no\none else can take your place?!

Yes, although I certainly wasn't trying to!
I came here to get some rest, but your
incessant whinging couldn't help but catch
my poor ears.
Now listen well, you: I, the great and\npowerful Emperor Emile, have decided to\nmake the people here my servants!
I shall take every last one of them back to\nthe Dyrenell Empire and put them to work\nfor my glorious name!
Ha ha! I think your brother's saying he's\ngoing to take responsibility for your people\nand give them a chance at a new life.
Which means you're free to go search\nfor a means to fight the Progenitor. Boom!
A trusty big brother is a good thing.
What the devil are you prattling on about?\nI care not a whit about what you people do\nfrom this point forth!

However, I cannot stand by as you engage
in the laughable idea of self-indulgent
frippery which says you alone must protect
the people of Grams.
Those people do not want YOU to protect\nthemâ€”they want ANYONE to protect them!
The fact you believe that you and you alone\ncan do this is high comedy! Why, I may\nwet myself with laughter! Aha ha ha ha!

Basically, it's great that you have such a
strong sense of responsibility, but that
doesn't mean you need to carry every
single load all by yourself.
Silence! How dare you twist my words\nto fit your own interpretations, you churl!\nWho even ARE you?!
All right. I understand. I entrust the people\nto you, Emileâ€”and thank you.
We'd better hurry and let everyone know\nthe new plan.
Oh, this ain't good! There's a horde of\ncorrupted fiends coming this way!
And not just fiends, but dragons!
If they break through, we're going to lose\na lot of people. We must stop them here,\nwhatever it takes!
Many of them have suffered injuries...\nI hope they're well enough to fight...
What am I saying? Forget them.\nI need to get myself somewhere safe!
